questions.questionText: What is a List in Java?
questions.correctAnswer: An ordered collection that can contain duplicate elements.
questions.explanation:
A List in Java is part of the Collections Framework and represents an ordered collection where elements are stored in a specific sequence.

• Order
Elements in a List maintain the order in which they are inserted, and each element can be accessed using an index.

• Duplicates
A List allows duplicate elements, meaning the same value can appear multiple times.

• Implementations
Common implementations of the List interface include ArrayList, LinkedList, and Vector.

• Usage
Lists are commonly used when the order of elements matters and when frequent access or iteration over elements is required.
